intro: Tulipa balcanica, commonly known as the Balkan tulip, is a species native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a herbaceous perennial plant that produces showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters and thrives in well-drained, loamy soils. Its bulbs are adapted to survive in temperate climates with cold winters and warm, dry summers. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, emerging from the base of the plant in early spring.
